yahoo_finance.title: Foxconn's profits rise on AI server demand, teases OpenAI announcement
yahoo_finance.content:
STORY: Foxconn posted a forecast-beating 17% rise in Q3 profit Wednesday (November 12). 

It was fueled by continued strength in demand for AI servers that it also expects to drive growth next year.

The Taiwanese firm is the the world's largest contract electronics maker and supplies U.S. majors like Apple and Nvidia.

It said third-quarter net profit hit $1.89 billion. 

Looking ahead, Foxconn feels bullish and said it should see year-on-year revenue growth in Q4. 

It expects AI server revenue to increase quarter-on-quarter. 

And for its full year revenue, it forecast significant year-on-year growth - in line with its earlier projections.

The firm also teased an announcement next week with ChatGPT-maker OpenAI, though it didn't provide details.

Foxconn's shares have surged 36% so far this year.

Its shares closed up 1.8% on Wednesday ahead of the earnings release.

yahoo_finance.title: AI Weekly: Softbank goes 'all-in', OpenAI in hot water
yahoo_finance.content:
STORY: From Softbank spooking investors to OpenAI landing in hot water.

This is AI Weekly.

:: AI Weekly

Softbank's spending for its so-called 'all-in' bet on ChatGPT maker OpenAI and other investments concerned markets.

Shares slid by a tenth after the Japanese investment giant sold $5.8 billion of its Nvidia stake.

Market watchers saw that as a sign of a growing funding demand.

The stock drop came despite second-quarter profit doubling largely thanks to the Sam Altman-led OpenAI's rising valuation.

OpenAI was itself in hot water in Germany.

A court found it broke the country's copyright laws by reproducing lyrics from songs by best-selling musician Herbert Groenemeyer and others.

The case, which was closely watched, was over the U.S. firm's use of lyrics to train its language models.

A judge ordered OpenAI to pay damages for the use of copyrighted material, without disclosing a figure.

Kai Welp is a lawyer for German music rights society GEMA, who brought the case.

"We assume that the legal dispute is not yet over, but that the case will be appealed. But we do hope, of course, that this will also send a signal regarding the legal situation in Europe, that the big technology companies will now also enter into license negotiations."

Foxconn smashed past forecasts with a 17% rise in third-quarter profit.

The number was driven by continued strength in demand for AI servers.

The Taiwanese firm is the world's largest contract electronics maker and supplies heavyweights like Nvidia and Apple.

Looking ahead, Foxconn believes the AI boom will help push yet more revenue growth in the fourth quarter.

Meta's chief AI scientist plans to leave the social media giant to launch his own start-up.

That's according to a report in Britain's Financial Times.

It said deep-learning pioneer Yann LeCun plans to depart for his own startup.

It further reported LeCun is in early talks to raise funds for a new venture.

And Intel saw its own big departure as the firm's chief technology officer left for OpenAI.

Sachin Katti had led the U.S. chipmaker's AI efforts since around the start of the year.

OpenAI said Katti will design and build the company's compute infrastructure, which will power its research into artificial general intelligence.

Intel said its CEO Lip-Bu Tan would now oversee its AI efforts.

yahoo_finance.title: Nvidia Supplier Foxconn Posts 17% Profit Jump on AI Server Demand
yahoo_finance.content: AI boom boosts Foxconn's server business as Nvidia partnership drives growth.

yahoo_finance.title: Foxconn's profits rise on AI server demand, teases OpenAI announcement
yahoo_finance.content:
STORY: Foxconn posted a forecast-beating 17% rise in Q3 profit Wednesday (November 12). 

It was fueled by continued strength in demand for AI servers that it also expects to drive growth next year.

The Taiwanese firm is the the world's largest contract electronics maker and supplies U.S. majors like Apple and Nvidia.

It said third-quarter net profit hit $1.89 billion. 

Looking ahead, Foxconn feels bullish and said it should see year-on-year revenue growth in Q4. 

It expects AI server revenue to increase quarter-on-quarter. 

And for its full year revenue, it forecast significant year-on-year growth - in line with its earlier projections.

The firm also teased an announcement next week with ChatGPT-maker OpenAI, though it didn't provide details.

Foxconn's shares have surged 36% so far this year.

Its shares closed up 1.8% on Wednesday ahead of the earnings release.

yahoo_finance.title: Investors Now See Some Companies as Safer Bets Than Governments
yahoo_finance.content: In corporate boardrooms since the pandemic era, executives have dealt with the rise in interest rates by keeping budgets lean and reducing overall indebtedness.  Meanwhile, governments in rich countries continue to spend, with the average debt-to-output ratio across the Group of Seven industrialized nations set to keep rising until the end of this decade at least.  The result: Investors demand lower yields for bonds issued by Microsoft Corp., Airbus SE, L’Oreal SA, and Siemens AG than they do for their countries of origin.

yahoo_finance.title: Nvidia Supplier Foxconn Posts 17% Profit Jump on AI Server Demand
yahoo_finance.content: AI boom boosts Foxconn's server business as Nvidia partnership drives growth.

yahoo_finance.title: Foxconn's profits rise on AI server demand, teases OpenAI announcement
yahoo_finance.content:
STORY: Foxconn posted a forecast-beating 17% rise in Q3 profit Wednesday (November 12). 

It was fueled by continued strength in demand for AI servers that it also expects to drive growth next year.

The Taiwanese firm is the the world's largest contract electronics maker and supplies U.S. majors like Apple and Nvidia.

It said third-quarter net profit hit $1.89 billion. 

Looking ahead, Foxconn feels bullish and said it should see year-on-year revenue growth in Q4. 

It expects AI server revenue to increase quarter-on-quarter. 

And for its full year revenue, it forecast significant year-on-year growth - in line with its earlier projections.

The firm also teased an announcement next week with ChatGPT-maker OpenAI, though it didn't provide details.

Foxconn's shares have surged 36% so far this year.

Its shares closed up 1.8% on Wednesday ahead of the earnings release.

Meanwhile, governments in rich countries continue to spend, with the average debt-to-output ratio across the Group of Seven industrialized nations set to keep rising until the end of this decade at least.  The result: Investors demand lower yields for bonds issued by Microsoft Corp., Airbus SE, L’Oreal SA, and Siemens AG than they do for their countries of origin.

yahoo_finance.title: Nvidia Supplier Foxconn Posts 17% Profit Jump on AI Server Demand
yahoo_finance.content: AI boom boosts Foxconn's server business as Nvidia partnership drives growth.

yahoo_finance.title: Foxconn's profits rise on AI server demand, teases OpenAI announcement
yahoo_finance.content:
STORY: Foxconn posted a forecast-beating 17% rise in Q3 profit Wednesday (November 12). 

It was fueled by continued strength in demand for AI servers that it also expects to drive growth next year.

The Taiwanese firm is the the world's largest contract electronics maker and supplies U.S. majors like Apple and Nvidia.

It said third-quarter net profit hit $1.89 billion. 

Looking ahead, Foxconn feels bullish and said it should see year-on-year revenue growth in Q4. 

It expects AI server revenue to increase quarter-on-quarter. 

And for its full year revenue, it forecast significant year-on-year growth - in line with its earlier projections.

The firm also teased an announcement next week with ChatGPT-maker OpenAI, though it didn't provide details.

Foxconn's shares have surged 36% so far this year.

Its shares closed up 1.8% on Wednesday ahead of the earnings release.

yahoo_finance.title: Nvidia Supplier Foxconn Posts 17% Profit Jump on AI Server Demand
yahoo_finance.content: AI boom boosts Foxconn's server business as Nvidia partnership drives growth.

yahoo_finance.title: Foxconn's profits rise on AI server demand, teases OpenAI announcement
yahoo_finance.content:
STORY: Foxconn posted a forecast-beating 17% rise in Q3 profit Wednesday (November 12). 

It was fueled by continued strength in demand for AI servers that it also expects to drive growth next year.

The Taiwanese firm is the the world's largest contract electronics maker and supplies U.S. majors like Apple and Nvidia.

It said third-quarter net profit hit $1.89 billion. 

Looking ahead, Foxconn feels bullish and said it should see year-on-year revenue growth in Q4. 

It expects AI server revenue to increase quarter-on-quarter. 

And for its full year revenue, it forecast significant year-on-year growth - in line with its earlier projections.

The firm also teased an announcement next week with ChatGPT-maker OpenAI, though it didn't provide details.

Foxconn's shares have surged 36% so far this year.

Its shares closed up 1.8% on Wednesday ahead of the earnings release.

yahoo_finance.content: In corporate boardrooms since the pandemic era, executives have dealt with the rise in interest rates by keeping budgets lean and reducing overall indebtedness.  Meanwhile, governments in rich countries continue to spend, with the average debt-to-output ratio across the Group of Seven industrialized nations set to keep rising until the end of this decade at least.  The result: Investors demand lower yields for bonds issued by Microsoft Corp., Airbus SE, L’Oreal SA, and Siemens AG than they do for their countries of origin.

yahoo_finance.title: Nvidia Supplier Foxconn Posts 17% Profit Jump on AI Server Demand
yahoo_finance.content: AI boom boosts Foxconn's server business as Nvidia partnership drives growth.

yahoo_finance.title: Foxconn's profits rise on AI server demand, teases OpenAI announcement
yahoo_finance.content:
STORY: Foxconn posted a forecast-beating 17% rise in Q3 profit Wednesday (November 12). 

It was fueled by continued strength in demand for AI servers that it also expects to drive growth next year.

The Taiwanese firm is the the world's largest contract electronics maker and supplies U.S. majors like Apple and Nvidia.

It said third-quarter net profit hit $1.89 billion. 

Looking ahead, Foxconn feels bullish and said it should see year-on-year revenue growth in Q4. 

It expects AI server revenue to increase quarter-on-quarter. 

And for its full year revenue, it forecast significant year-on-year growth - in line with its earlier projections.

The firm also teased an announcement next week with ChatGPT-maker OpenAI, though it didn't provide details.

Foxconn's shares have surged 36% so far this year.

Its shares closed up 1.8% on Wednesday ahead of the earnings release.

yahoo_finance.title: Disney warns of potentially long YouTube TV dispute, shares fall
yahoo_finance.content:
STORY: Shares of Disney plunged as much as 9% Thursday morning after the company warned of a potentially lengthy battle with YouTube TV over distribution of its television channels.

Disney's networks disappeared from YouTube TV - the fourth-largest pay-TV provider in the U.S. - on October 30. 

It's the latest dispute over distribution rights between the entertainment giants. NBCUniversal had a similar dispute with YouTube TV earlier this year.

Morgan Stanley analysts estimate a 14-day blackout on YouTube TV would cost Disney about $60 million in revenue.

The tense discussions underscore YouTube TV's rapid growth - it now has 10 million subscribers - as well as parent company Alphabet's vast financial resources, giving it greater leverage in corporate negotiations.

The distribution battle, as well as a quarterly revenue miss, overshadowed some bright spots in Disney's third-quarter results.

Those included a profit beat powered by strong growth in the company's streaming and parks businesses.

Disney said it added 12.5 million subscribers to Disney+ and Hulu during the quarter, reaching a total of 196 million users.

It also unveiled plans to boost its dividend by 50% and double its share buyback plan for fiscal 2026.

yahoo_finance.title: Meta prevails in historic FTC antitrust case, won't have to break off WhatsApp, Instagram
yahoo_finance.content: Meta has prevailed over an existential challenge to its business that could have forced the tech giant to spin off Instagram and WhatsApp after a judge ruled that the company does not hold a monopoly in social networking.  U.S. District Judge James Boasberg issued his ruling Tuesday after the historic antitrust trial wrapped up in late May. His decision follows two separate rulings that branded Google an illegal monopoly in both search and online advertising, dealing yet another regulatory blow to the tech industry that for years enjoyed nearly unbridled growth.  The Federal Trade Commission “continues to insist that Meta competes with the same old rivals it has for the last decade, that the company holds a monopoly among that small set, and that it maintained that monopoly through anticompetitive acquisitions,” Boasberg wrote in his ruling.

yahoo_finance.title: Wall Street's AI-driven surge put to test by Nvidia results
yahoo_finance.content:
STORY: U.S. stocks started Tuesday in the red as concerns about lofty equity valuations intensified.

Megacap tech stocks led the decline including those of AI-related companies such as chip powerhouse Nvidia.

It reports earnings after the closing bell on Wednesday and the results are seen as a litmus test for the AI-driven rally that has pushed markets to record highs this year.

Market participants will be hanging on every word from CEO Jensen Huang on the company’s outlook, including Wedbush Securities Managing Director Dan Ives. 

“It's a Super Bowl for tech [stock] owners. Nvidia, the godfather of AI, Jensen [Huang] and that's the foundation of the AI revolution. We expect robust numbers that should demand accelerating not just for Nvidia chips, but overall demand of the AI revolution.”

One chief investment strategist tells Reuters that investors will be reviewing the results with a fine-tooth comb, looking for any sort of cracks and scrutinizing the guidance to see if this is the beginning of a potentially deeper problem.

Ives says he thinks investors are missing the larger picture.

“In my opinion, investors are underestimating the scale and scope of what this is going to look like with robotics, with autonomous, with the future.”

Ives dismisses talk of a bubble and says the bull market will continue for another two years.

yahoo_finance.title: Waymo’s new Zeekr robotaxi seen testing in San Diego
yahoo_finance.content:
STORY: :: San Diego, California

:: November 19, 2025

:: Waymo’s new Zeekr robotaxi is spotted testing in San Diego before services start in the city next year

:: The vehicle developed with Chinese automaker Geely is part of Waymo’s expansion to Las Vegas, San Diego and Detroit

Waymo announced in early November it will launch its robotaxi service in Las Vegas, San Diego and Detroit next year, marking its biggest geographic expansion yet.

The Alphabet unit will also start driving its new Zeekr-built vehicles, alongside its existing Jaguar I-PACE fleet, it added.

The new Zeekr model, developed with Chinese automaker Geely, are designed specifically for robotaxi use cases and will be rolled out gradually as the company expands its service.

Companies like Waymo, Tesla TSLA.O and Amazon's Zoox are investing billions into self-driving technology.

Tesla launched its long-awaited robotaxi service earlier this year, while Waymo already operates driverless services in Phoenix, San Francisco, Los Angeles, and Austin, and has completed more than 10 million trips.

yahoo_finance.title: Markets Surge as Nvidia Earnings Reignite the AI Rally. Stock Futures Soar.
yahoo_finance.content: Stock futures were surging Thursday after chip maker Nvidia issued strong revenue guidance for the current quarter, putting to bed any fears that the artificial-intelligence boom was about to fizzle out.  S&P 500 futures added 1.3%, and contracts tied to the tech-heavy Nasdaq 100 jumped 1.7%.  Nvidia beat analysts’ estimates for earnings and revenue and provided a January-quarter forecast that was well above Wall Street’s expectations, sending its shares up 5.1% in late trading.
